page.title: 11TRENODE CofE NR.WIDEGATES
page.content: Trenode school was built in 1872 by Rev. James Buller Kitson.It has a high roof which is unique in Cornwall. No false ceiling is allowed so heating is difficult and expensive.The chancel has been opened out to give more classroom space .The main building also has a kitchen and infant room which is also used as a dining room.Trenode has an Elliott classroom for 1st and 2nd years.The P.T.A. bought and equipped a caravan for use as a staffroom, office and teaching area.It has been in use for 3 terms and made a tremendous difference keeping steady continuity of teaching.
